intro: [WRONG START] Embilia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest areas and is often found in mountainous regions. Its fruits are small, round, and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
